title: Design and Operational Strategies for Web-Based Social Constructivist Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Participants Are Professionals in Social Fields Linked to Job Roles, with Limited Web Tool Experience in BYOD Settings

learning_goals: Learners can perform knowledge construction activities among peers at over 80% proficiency using web-based collaboration tools (chat, video conferencing, etc.)
Learners can design online discussion strategies based on social constructivist principles and apply them to actual classes
Learners can analyze communication barriers arising when using web tools and propose three methods to enhance interaction
Learners can develop a rubric for evaluating instructor-learner engagement in digital environments and apply it to formative assessment

resources: Real-Time Collaboration Tools (e.g., Padlet, Google Jamboard)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
